channel.title: [317] Omega Framework
channel.description:
[center] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/sY7UPy5.png[/img] [URL=https://github.com/Driman/Omega-1.0]Github[/URL]
[size=18pt]Introduction[/size] [SPOILER= Introduction] So after I stopped playing Jagex's Transformers Universe, I decided to continue editing my Delta server. After a few thoughts and debates, I decided on the decision to just make a framework and do it, since I can't be arsed to renaming every single class and removing all the useless codes. If you want to know how it all started, I said "Fuck it, lets do a framework". [B]This was my 7th attempt on making a framework[/B], and I FINALLY MADE ONE WOOTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT!!!!!!!!
This is incomplete, I was going to finish the framework completely and make a complete login, but I was to excited. I will be working on this framework until I can make a base out of this. I will also be starting from scratch again, since I rushed with the login protocol, just to see if I was doing it right.
[B]This took me around 3 hours to make in total.[/B] [/SPOILER]
[size=18pt]Media[/size] [SPOILER= Media] [IMG]https://dl.dropbox.com/s/z6bg7kin4n7x5fw/lol.png[/img]
[IMG]https://dl.dropbox.com/s/e4e5ggzjbo3lm0j/Screenshot%202014-07-10%2018.13.12.png[/img] [/SPOILER]
[size=18pt]Credits[/size] [SPOILER=Authors] [size=8pt][I](Not in particular order)[/I][/size] [URL=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=630180]Carlos Sanchez-Aviles[/URL] - All the work [URL=https://github.com/blakeman8192]Blakeman8192[/URL] - Stream and Cryption [URL=https://www.jagex.com/]Jagex Ltd.[/URL] - Client [/SPOILER]
[size=18pt]Bugs[/size] [SPOILER=Bugs] [B]1-[/B] There's a minor problem loading the player's username, a strange symbol i shows up but I made a workaround fix for this. [SPOILER=The Fix] [I]THIS IS IN THE SERVER FILES.[/I] I am just showing this, in hope of someone helping me fix the issue with the i symbol. [CODE=JAVA] +player.getUsername().replace("ì", "")[/CODE] [/SPOILER] [B]2-[/B] The client does not disconnect after you close the socket connection. [B]3-[/B] Not a bug, just a missing feature - A login is not fully established, which causes the server to disconnect and reconnect. [/SPOILER]
[size=18pt]Downloads[/size] [SPOILER=Download] https://www.dropbox.com/s/v6dsghka4489pvp/Omega.zip [/SPOILER]
[size=18pt]How I learned Java[/size] [SPOILER=Learn to code] [I](This is what I used to study, in order to improve my Java knowledge this past month)[/I]
[B]I learned a lot about Networking these past weeks by this tutorial.[/B] [URL=http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/networking/overview/networking.html]TCP Socket[/URL]
[B]I barely look at this.[/B] [URL=http://]http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/]Java Docs[/URL]
[B]I learned a lot about Netty with this guy[/B] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aI_bvkT94sA
[B]Why to use Winterlove[/B] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aHv13EoHjyc [/SPOILER] [/center]

item.title: [317] Omega Framework
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Driman Rune, post:36, topic:544834”][quote author=Dan0194 link=topic=663712.msg4436151#msg4436151 date=1405118324]
No offence man but it looks like your just taking other source’s files and putting them together.
[/quote]

[B]1-[/B] The only files I took were the StreamBuffer, ISAACCIPHER, and Packet. Most people who make frameworks, usually just rip them out of hyperion or wherever they came from.
[SPOILER=Let me tell you who…]
Michael P, Lare96, cba to find more…
[/SPOILER]
[B]2-[/B] It may look like I am ripping it out, but I am not.
[B]3-[/B] I’m capable on writing my own content.
[B]4-[/B] I’m not that great at naming, so I usually just look at Lare’s, RuneSource, Delta, and Project Insanity and look why they name it that.
[B]5-[/B] Pretty sure all bases have at-least 60% of the same class names, or somewhat very similiar.(Example: my positions class is similiar to that of Hyperion’s and RuneSource).
[B]6-[/B] I’ve looked at Micheal’s Netty 317, Project Insanity, and the tutorial I learned on making a basic Netty Server, they’re the same class names, and methods. So why change it?
[B]7-[/B] I’m looking at other sources and seeing how they’re handling the server, I do this for all the listed servers above.
[B]8-[/B] I’m trying to keep this simple, for others to use.
[B]9-[/B] I have looked at at-least 7 bases, and the networking methods, variables, are very very similar.
[b]10-[/B] Good game.[/quote]
I swear if you knew who Michael really was you’d be facepalming yourself reeeaaalllllyyyyy hard.

Right Michael buddy? <3

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Omega Framework
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

Going to redo the framework from scratch.

Version 1.1 will not be released but a private source code revision.

The reason behind 1.2, is people are saying I am just stealing other people’s work. I will be making a tutorial as well, and make a video of me coding the server and possibly a commentary.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Michael_P1 Michael P
item.description:
@Michael_P1 wrote:

[quote=“Driman Rune, post:36, topic:544834”][quote author=Dan0194 link=topic=663712.msg4436151#msg4436151 date=1405118324]
No offence man but it looks like your just taking other source’s files and putting them together.
[/quote]

[B]1-[/B] The only files I took were the StreamBuffer, ISAACCIPHER, and Packet. Most people who make frameworks, usually just rip them out of hyperion or wherever they came from.
[SPOILER=Let me tell you who…]
Michael P, Lare96, cba to find more…
[/SPOILER]
[B]2-[/B] It may look like I am ripping it out, but I am not.
[B]3-[/B] I’m capable on writing my own content.
[B]4-[/B] I’m not that great at naming, so I usually just look at Lare’s, RuneSource, Delta, and Project Insanity and look why they name it that.
[B]5-[/B] Pretty sure all bases have at-least 60% of the same class names, or somewhat very similiar.(Example: my positions class is similiar to that of Hyperion’s and RuneSource).
[B]6-[/B] I’ve looked at Micheal’s Netty 317, Project Insanity, and the tutorial I learned on making a basic Netty Server, they’re the same class names, and methods. So why change it?
[B]7-[/B] I’m looking at other sources and seeing how they’re handling the server, I do this for all the listed servers above.
[B]8-[/B] I’m trying to keep this simple, for others to use.
[B]9-[/B] I have looked at at-least 7 bases, and the networking methods, variables, are very very similar.
[b]10-[/B] Good game.[/quote]

You’re an idiot.

item.description:

I meant used not rip, lare.

What I think lare96 is trying to say is, don’t give him credits for crap code even if it’s got his name written all over it

what? lol
[/quote]
He’s using your cheap code and haxing everything you’ve made into this project with a hint of PI to spice things up. I think.[/quote]
No I don’t steal codes and don’t give credits. I give credits to the original author, as you guys will see. If you’re saying I’m stealing his code you’re an idiot, because my style is a lot different than his. His is more advanced, whilst mine is that of a 6th grader.

I give credits to lare for having his Emerald up, so I can use it as a resource.

item.title: [317] Omega Framework
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

Finished the Netty Framework.

I had a bit trouble, because as much as I love Netty, I am not the best at it nor worse. I sometimes forget what to do, because there’s so many things to do unlike the simple Thread per Client.

Will be adding a bit more before I release it.

As you can see by the packaging, it’s heavily influenced on RuneSource, and a bit of Project Insanity.

[SIZE=7]GET FAPPING…[/SIZE]

Read full topic
